message.content: A sweet pepper, also known as a bell pepper or Capsicum annuum, is a type of vegetable that belongs to the nightshade family. It is a cultivar of the pepper plant and is known for its mild, sweet flavor. The fruit of the sweet pepper is usually large and has a distinct bell shape with three to four lobes. The skin of a sweet pepper can be green, yellow, orange, red, or even purple depending on the variety. The texture of the sweet pepper is firm and smooth, with a thick and juicy flesh inside. Sweet peppers are commonly used in cooking, salads, or eaten raw as a healthy snack. They are grown all over the world and can be easily found in grocery stores or farmers' markets.
